title: Will IEM San Jose be played on the new patch?

replies.body: Nope, IEM San Jose will be played on 5.21.

> [{quoted}](name=Tiza,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=qIu34QFw,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-11-12T02:18:07.304+0000)
>
> Nope, IEM San Jose will be played on 5.21.

Why? I have to wonder why the Pro side of the game has been so far behind live? It felt really weird watching Worlds be 3 patches behind

> [{quoted}](name=Jbels,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=qIu34QFw,comment-id=00010001,timestamp=2015-11-12T14:20:54.913+0000)
>
> Why? I have to wonder why the Pro side of the game has been so far behind live? It felt really weird watching Worlds be 3 patches behind

We usually patch Tournament Realms (the special servers we use for competition) a week after a patch goes live, primarily to avoid any hotfix issues (things that result in "X has been temporarily disabled" popups).  We also don't change patches during the LCS Playoffs to ensure more consistency - we value adaptability to the meta as part of the regular season and the "long run" game, but don't find it appropriate for playoffs.  Worlds is a special case - our tolerance for potential bugs is _much_ lower.

tl;dr Ale non è male nailed it.
